title: 112_hr4234
content: The "Grazing Improvement Act of 2012" amends the terms of grazing permits and leases by extending the duration to 20 years. It also includes provisions for the renewal, transfer, and reissuance of grazing permits and leases under the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The "Grazing Improvement Act of 2012" defines current grazing management and the Secretary concerned. It also addresses the renewal, transfer, and reissuance of grazing permits and leases under specific sections. The "Grazing Improvement Act of 2012" outlines the renewal, transfer, and reissuance of grazing permits and leases under specific sections, including terms and conditions that continue until processing is completed by the Secretary concerned. Permit or lease cancellation, suspension, or modification is allowed in accordance with applicable law. The Secretary concerned may renew or reissue a permit or lease for 20 years after processing completion. The renewal, reissuance, or transfer of a grazing permit may be excluded from environmental assessment if it continues current management, meets objectives, or aligns with department policy. The Department of the Interior or Agriculture will determine priority and timing for completing environmental analyses for grazing allotments. NEPA exemptions include crossing authorizations and grazing preference transfers. Amendments to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 are made. Amendments to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 include provisions for renewal, transfer, and reissuance of grazing permits and leases.
